gauri_lp: @redheadwayfarer I am so bloody proud of you. So proud. This post made me cry, honestly. People refuse to understand that this fight is about freeing the female body from norms and stigmas. It's about understanding that the fight for breaking the societal constraints surrounding the female body is the biggest fight. How can a girl achieve her dreams if half her life is spent being tied down by what she can or cannot wear? If every day she keeps wondering if her bra strap is showing and how that will attract unwanted attention? If even her basic biological needs are surrounded by disgust, ignorance and more ignorance? This fight is about understanding that our body is ours. You don't get to decide what we want or not. It's about understanding that we the restrictions placed upon us are not only wrong but sometimes painful, both physically and mentally. This is a fight to stop people from telling girls that they should be careful and not be out in public, late at night but rather to tell the boys that girls are humans too and force shows how weak they are. It is to understand that we do not want more rights than men but we deserve the same respect in all regards. Its about having a choice and deciding what we want. It's not about the culture or religion or men. It's about women who are not allowed to be comfortable in their bodies.
